senses.de: Something or someone that you are trying to do something to or achieve
senses.ex: The company's main target is to increase sales by 10% this year.

Tips.title: Aspire and Plan
Tips.description: Use 'target' to describe what you hope to achieve and how you plan to do it.
Tips.example: Our target is to finish the project by June.

Tips.title: Quantifiable Goals
Tips.description: 'Target' often refers to specific, measurable achievements, especially in business.
Tips.example: We've set a target of 500 unit sales this month.

senses.de: A circular or other mark aimed at in sports or games
senses.ex: He hit the target in the center with his arrow.

Tips.title: Precision Needed
Tips.description: 'Target' in sports or games highlights the importance of accuracy.
Tips.example: The archer's target was a small red dot.

Tips.title: Game Jargon
Tips.description: In games, 'target' can be a physical object or a metaphor for the score to beat.
Tips.example: To win, your target is 200 points.

senses.de: An object or area that is being attacked or may be attacked
senses.ex: The military has identified several potential targets.

Tips.title: Conflict Zones
Tips.description: In a military context, a 'target' is something to be neutralized or captured.
Tips.example: Troops were briefed on the enemy targets before the mission.

Tips.title: Potential Threats
Tips.description: 'Target' may imply that an object or place is under threat of attack.
Tips.example: Satellite imagery showed the locations of strategic targets.

senses.de: To decide to direct an attack or criticism at someone or something
senses.ex: The company is targeting young people in its advertising.

Tips.title: Specific Demographics
Tips.description: When 'targeting' an audience, you're focusing on a particular group's needs or interests.
Tips.example: The ad campaign targets homeowners over 50.

Tips.title: Strategic Planning
Tips.description: To 'target' means to approach with a clear, strategic plan to achieve an aim.
Tips.example: Our charity is targeting the most affected areas for aid distribution.

Aim.wordDefinition:
Aim refers to the act of pointing or directing someone or something towards a specific goal or objective. It is an action that is taken to achieve a desired result.

For example, a person aiming to become a doctor would have a plan of action which includes studying hard and passing relevant examinations.

Aim is the action that is taken towards achieving a target. The target is the specific goal that a person or organization is trying to achieve.

Ambition.wordDefinition:
Ambition refers to a strong desire or goal for success, achievement, or power in one's future career or life. It is a personal drive to excel in something.

Ambition is more about personal aspiration and long-term goals, while target is more about the specific aim or goal to be achieved in the short term.

Ambition is applicable in personal and career development, while target is applicable in project management and goal-setting.

Aspiration.wordDefinition:
Aspiration refers to a goal or ambition that one wants to achieve. It is a long-term and often broad and abstract vision of what someone wants for themselves.

Both aspiration and target are important for setting and achieving goals. Aspiration provides a big-picture vision and direction, while targets help in breaking down that vision into smaller, achievable steps.

Aspiration is useful in identifying what one truly wants out of life, while targets are useful in tracking progress and ensuring that one stays on course towards achieving their aspirations.

Destination.wordDefinition:
Destination refers to the place where someone or something is going or being sent, while target refers to a specific goal or objective.

For instance, if you are planning a trip, your destination is the place you are traveling to.

Destination is more commonly used in the context of travel or transportation, while target is more often used in the context of setting and achieving goals.

Goal.wordDefinition:
A goal is a general statement of what you want to achieve. It is a broader concept that outlines the direction you want to move in.

For example, a goal for a student could be to get good grades.

A target is more specific and measurable. It is a precise and quantifiable aim that breaks down a goal into smaller achievable steps.

A goal is a broad, overarching objective that you want to attain, whereas a target is a specific, measurable step towards achieving that goal.

Intent.wordDefinition: Intent refers to the purpose or goal someone has in mind when doing something. It's applicable in situations where someone is trying to achieve a specific outcome or result, like setting goals for the future.

Objective.wordDefinition:
Objective refers to a specific goal or purpose, while target is more specific and refers to a specific number or amount that is aimed to achieve.

For example, a company's objective might be to increase profits, while their target might be to increase profits by 10% within the next year.

Objectives are more general and can be used in the context of setting overall goals, while targets are more specific and can be used to track progress and measure success.

Objectives are applicable in a variety of settings, from personal goals to business strategies, while targets are often used in a business or organizational context to measure progress or success against a specific benchmark.

Point.wordDefinition:
Point refers to a specific spot or location. For example, you can point at a particular object or location with your finger.

In summary, while point refers to a physical location, target refers to a desired outcome or goal.

Purpose.wordDefinition:
Purpose refers to the reason or intention behind something, while the word target refers to the goal or object that is being aimed at or pursued.

For example, if you are studying for a test, your purpose is to learn the material so that you can do well on the exam.

Purpose is applicable when discussing the reasoning or motivation behind an action or decision, while target is applicable when discussing a specific goal or objective that is being pursued or aimed at.

quotes.Text: There are a lot of messages in my books which I have specifically targeted for children, based on my own experiences growing up: the importance of healthy eating and being active, playing fair, setting goals, working together and anti-bullying.
quotes.Title: Australian Athlete
quotes.Name: Israel Folau

quotes.Text: When my dad first started out in the police force, wearing the uniform was a sense of pride, and it was respected in the community for what the police force was all about. Unfortunately today, the uniform is a target.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jerry Doyle

quotes.Text: I haven't set myself any goals or targets because I am taking each day as it comes. But who is to say that I can't be a world champion, or do anything that I put my mind to?
quotes.Title: English Entertainer
quotes.Name: Fallon Sherrock

quotes.Text: Our enemy, the devil, wants to control us, and his target is our will. The main way he tries to influence our will is through lying to us.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: I think all great players set a target for themselves in their careers. Mine was to win a world title with Brazil, which I did twice.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Athlete
quotes.Name: Ronaldo

quotes.Text: The government targets 'Anonymous' for the same reason it targets al-Qaida - because they're the enemy.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: John Perry Barlow

quotes.Text: I believe the target of anything in life should be to do it so well that it becomes an art.
quotes.Title: French Coach
quotes.Name: Arsene Wenger

quotes.Text: Setting targets is very important in my life; I always have targets to fulfil.
quotes.Title: Egyptian Athlete
quotes.Name: Essam El Hadary

quotes.Text: My target is to expand the BJP's influence everywhere.
quotes.Title: Indian Politician
quotes.Name: Amit Shah

quotes.Text: My target has always been world No.1, I want that.
quotes.Title: English Celebrity
quotes.Name: Rob Cross
